case_vignette:
A 43-year-old female presents to clinic for evaluation of hair loss along the frontal scalp ongoing over the past year. She reports a twenty year long history of wearing a wig daily and secures her hair in place with tight headband underneath. She denies any significant pain or pruritus in the areas of hair loss. She has tried numerous over the counter oils and shampoos without any improvement. Physical examination reveals significant hair thinning an regression of the hairline with preservation of the hair follicles along the frontotemporal scalp. No significant perifollicular erythema is appreciated. The patient is concerned about the hair loss and is seeking a medical evaluation to determine the cause and potential treatment options.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing hair loss along the front of my scalp for the past year.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I am a 43-year-old male.
Have you noticed any change in your libido or experienced any erectile dysfunction?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in my libido or erectile dysfunction.
Are there any other symptoms you have noticed, such as nail changes, rashes, or changes in your skin?
No, I haven't noticed any nail changes, rashes, or other changes in my skin.
Do you have a history of similar symptoms in your family?
No, I do not have a history of similar symptoms in my family.
Have you been under significant stress or changed your diet radically in the last year?
No, I haven't been under significant stress or made radical changes to my diet in the last year.
Final Diagnosis: Androgenetic alopecia
